title: Git Workflow for Research
text:
Git Workflow for Research
This is a draft blog post about using Git to maintain versions of academic work.
In this post, I’ll explore:

Why version control matters for research
How to use branches for experimentation
Committing as a research practice

[This is still being written - more content coming soon]

Create that file, save it, and then **stage it** (click the "+" next to it in the Source Control panel).

Once you've staged it, **write a commit message** and commit it. The message could be:
